intro: Theophrasta regalis, commonly known as the royal theophrasta, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
